Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, fabric has a black core, interior covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, exterior covered with a light-brown slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.166)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36366) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36366)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 219 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13412 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
